summary: This is a letter from defense attorneys Martin G. Weinberg, Reid Weingarten, and Michael Miller to Assistant United States Attorneys in the Southern District of New York, supplementing a discovery request in the case United States v. Jeffrey Epstein. The letter seeks preservation and production of documents related to the 2006-2008 investigation and the Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA), specifically targeting communications and materials from the lead prosecutor in the Southern District of Florida and the FBI.

events.title: Initial Epstein Investigation
events.description: The period during which the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida and the FBI conducted an investigation into Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Lead Prosecutor's Trip to New York
events.description: The lead prosecutor from the Southern District of Florida traveled to New York in March 2008, which is a subject of the discovery request for related communications.

events.title: Initial Discovery Request
events.description: The defense team's first request for discovery was electronically mailed, which this letter supplements.

keyFacts: The defense is seeking discovery related to the 2006-2008 investigation and the Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA) from the Southern District of Florida and FBI.
The request specifically targets communications from the lead prosecutor in the Florida case, including around a March 2008 trip to New York.
The letter indicates the defense is investigating potential coordination or communication between the U.S. Attorney's Offices in Florida and New York from 2007-2019.
The document is part of the 2019 criminal case against Jeffrey Epstein in the Southern District of New York (Case No. 19-cr-00490).
